intro: Cousinia czatkalica, commonly known as the Karakoram globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Karakoram Mountains in Pakistan. It is a perennial herb that thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme climatic conditions. The plant features upright stems with dense clusters of yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Cousinia czatkalica plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
